workflow.name: Classify developer questions with GPT-4o from Slack to Notion & Airtable
workflow.description:
## üìò Description:
This workflow automates the Developer Q&A Classification and Documentation process using Slack, Azure OpenAI GPT-4o, Notion, Airtable, and Google Sheets.
Whenever a new message is posted in a specific Slack channel, the workflow automatically:
- Captures and validates the message data
- Uses GPT-4o (Azure OpenAI) to check if the question matches any existing internal FAQs
- Logs answered questions into Notion as new FAQ entries
- Sends unanswered ones to Airtable for human follow-up
- Records any workflow or API errors into Google Sheets
This ensures that every developer query is instantly categorized, documented, and tracked, turning daily Slack discussions into a continuously improving knowledge base.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ Slack Channel Trigger ‚Äì Developer Q&A
 Triggers the workflow whenever a new message is posted in a specific Slack channel. Captures message text, user ID, timestamp, and channel info.

üß© Validate Slack Message Payload (IF Node)
 Ensures the incoming message payload contains valid user and text data.
 ‚úÖ True Path ‚Üí Continues to extract and process the message
 ‚ùå False Path ‚Üí Logs error to Google Sheets

üíª Extract Question Metadata (JavaScript)
 Cleans and structures the Slack message into a standardized JSON format ‚Äî removing unnecessary characters and preparing a clean ‚Äúquestion object‚Äù for AI processing.

üß† Classify Developer Question (AI) (Powered by Azure OpenAI GPT-4o)
 Uses GPT-4o to semantically compare the question with an internal FAQ dataset.
 If a match is found ‚Üí Marks as answered and generates a canonical response
 If not ‚Üí Flags it as unanswered

üßæ Parse AI JSON Output (Code Node)
 Converts GPT-4o‚Äôs text output into structured JSON so that workflow logic can reference fields like status, answer_quality, and canonical_answer.

‚öñÔ∏è Check If Question Was Answered (IF Node)
 If status == "answered", the question is routed to Notion for documentation; otherwise, it‚Äôs logged in Airtable for review.

üìò Save Answered Question to Notion FAQ
 Creates a new Notion page under the ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù database containing the question, AI‚Äôs canonical answer, and answer quality rating ‚Äî automatically building a self-updating internal FAQ.

üìã Log Unanswered Question to Airtable
 Adds unresolved or new questions into Airtable for manual review by the developer support team. These records later feed back into the FAQ training loop.

üö® Log Workflow Errors to Google Sheets
 Any missing payloads, parsing errors, or failed integrations are logged in Google Sheets (error log sheet) for transparent tracking and debugging.

## üß© Prerequisites:
- Slack API credentials (for message trigger)
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o API credentials
- Notion API connection (for FAQ database)
- Airtable API credentials (for unresolved questions)
- Google Sheets OAuth connection (for error logging)

## üí° Key Benefits:
 ‚úÖ Automates Slack Q&A classification
 ‚úÖ Builds and updates internal FAQs with zero manual input
 ‚úÖ Ensures all developer queries are tracked
 ‚úÖ Reduces redundant questions in Slack
 ‚úÖ Maintains transparency with error logs

## üë• Perfect For:
- Engineering or support teams using Slack for developer communication
- Organizations maintaining internal FAQs in Notion
- Teams wanting to automatically capture and reuse knowledge from real developer interactions

parameters.content:
## Node Name: Slack Channel Trigger ‚Äì Developer Q&A
**Action**: Triggers the workflow when a new message is posted in the specified Slack channel.
**Description**:
This node listens for new messages in the Slack channel.  
Each time a developer posts a question or discussion message, it captures the message content, user ID, timestamp, and channel details.  
This initiates the automation for classifying and responding to developer Q&A.

## Node Name: Validate Slack Message Payload
**Action**: Checks if the incoming Slack message includes valid user and text data.
**Description**:
This node ensures that the incoming event payload contains both a valid user ID and message text before proceeding.  
If the message payload is incomplete or malformed, the workflow redirects execution to the error logging path.  
This step prevents unnecessary AI calls for empty or system-generated Slack messages.

## Node Name: Classify Developer Question (AI)
**Action**: Uses GPT-4o to determine whether the Slack message matches a known FAQ.
**Description**:
This AI Agent compares the new Slack question against an internal FAQ knowledge base.  
If a close match is found, GPT-4o returns structured JSON indicating ‚Äúanswered,‚Äù along with a canonical response and quality rating.  
If no match exists, it flags the query as ‚Äúunanswered,‚Äù prompting human follow-up.  
This ensures that recurring developer issues are identified and reused efficiently.

## Node Name: Extract Question Metadata (JavaScript)
**Action**: Cleans and structures Slack message data into a standardized JSON format.
**Description**:
This JavaScript node extracts key fields ‚Äî message text, user ID, timestamp, and channel ‚Äî and removes unwanted characters or formatting (`>`, newlines, quotes).  
It creates a clean ‚Äúquestion object‚Äù ready for AI classification, improving accuracy and processing consistency.

## Node Name: Configure GPT-4o Model
**Action**: Sets up Azure OpenAI GPT-4o as the active AI model.
**Description**:
This node configures the GPT-4o model as the underlying large language model for question classification and similarity matching.  
It enables intelligent comparison of Slack questions with internal FAQ data using semantic understanding.

## Node Name: Log Workflow Errors to Google Sheets
**Action**: Logs missing payloads or node execution errors into a Google Sheet.
**Description**:
If a Slack event, AI response, or integration call fails, this node appends an entry in the ‚Äúerror log sheet.‚Äù  
Each entry contains the error ID and description, enabling quick monitoring and debugging.  
This maintains workflow transparency and ensures no silent automation failures.

## Node Name: Parse AI JSON Output
**Action**: Converts the AI‚Äôs string output into structured JSON for further logic.
**Description**:
The GPT model returns text formatted as JSON, but downstream nodes require an actual object.  
This code node safely parses that text into valid JSON, making keys like `status`, `answer_quality`, and `canonical_answer` accessible for conditional checks.  
Acts as the bridge between the AI‚Äôs output and workflow logic.

## Node Name: Check If Question Was Answered
**Action**: Evaluates the AI‚Äôs response to decide if the Slack question was resolved.
**Description**:
This IF node checks whether `status == "answered"`.  
If true, the flow routes toward the Notion database for documentation.  
If false, it diverts to the Airtable node for escalation and manual review.  
Implements automated decision-making between documentation and triage paths.

## Node Name: Save Answered Question to Notion FAQ
**Action**: Logs answered questions and AI explanations in the Notion database.
**Description**:
This node creates a Notion entry within the database.  
It records fields like `Status`, `Answer Quality`, and the AI‚Äôs `Canonical Answer`.  
Helps maintain a living internal knowledge base automatically enriched from Slack discussions.  
Enables rapid reuse of resolved questions and promotes team self-help.

## Node Name: Log Unanswered Question to Airtable
**Action**: Records new or unrecognized questions into Airtable for review.
**Description**:
This Airtable node creates a record containing the Slack question text, user ID, message ID, and AI classification results.  
Used for tracking unresolved or novel issues that should be reviewed by developers or support engineers.  
Over time, these entries feed back into the internal FAQ training loop.

parameters.text:
=You are a Slack Q&A classifier for developer discussions.  
You have the following internal FAQ knowledge:

1. Q: How to connect local API server to staging database?  
   A: Update the `.env` file with staging DB credentials and restart the service.

2. Q: How to restart the backend server?  
   A: Run `pm2 restart backend` or `npm run serve` depending on environment.

3. Q: How to fix 401 error on /auth/login endpoint?  
   A: Ensure the auth token is refreshed using the /refresh-token route before login.

---

Your job:
When a new developer question comes in, check if it matches (or is similar) to one of the questions above.  
If yes, output JSON like this:
{
  "status": "answered",
  "answer_quality": "strong",
  "canonical_answer": "(matching answer from above)"
}

If no match found, output:
{
  "status": "unanswered",
  "answer_quality": "weak",
  "canonical_answer": ""
}
Always respond with clean JSON only.

Log Workflow Errors to Google Sheets

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
